publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2441 Mr Brian Monteith: National Pubs Weekâ€”That the Parliament acknowledges that National Pubs Week, organised by CAMRA, the Campaign for Real Ale, will be held between 19 and 26 February 2005; recognises that it is designed to encourage more people to visit pubs throughout the week and celebrate responsibly British and Scottish pubs; notes that, according to figures from the Scottish Beer and Pub Association, the beer and pub industry in Scotland employs 150,000 people in over 5,000 public houses; acknowledges that, UK-wide, eight out of 10 adults count themselves as pub-goers, that 12% of Scottish adults visit a pub at least once a week and that over 80% of pubs are small businesses run by tenants, lessees and owners, and wishes National Pubs Week success in achieving its aims. Supported by: Mr David Davidson*, Alex Johnstone*, Mark Ballard*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Scott Barrie* R
